pages.text: Graphite, archaically referred to as plumbago, is a crystalline form of the element $(l:materials/Carbon)carbon$(/l) with its atoms arranged in a hexagonal structure. It occurs naturally in this form and is the most stable form of $(l:materials/Carbon)carbon$(/l) under standard conditions. Under high pressures and temperatures it converts to diamond.
